document.docAuthor: László, Gyula M. & Vetina, Alvaro A.
document.masterDocTitle: Contribution to the knowledge of the Nolini of the Maputo Special Reserve in South Mozambique with description of two new species and several taxonomic updates (Lepidoptera, Nolidae, Nolinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Contribution to the knowledge of the Nolini of the Maputo Special Reserve in South Mozambique with description of two new species and several taxonomic updates (Lepidoptera, Nolidae, Nolinae)

heading.emphasis:
Mecothrix aegyptiaca cana Hacker, 2012
stat. n.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Nola (Mecothrix) cana
Hacker, 2012
, Esperiana 17: 158. Type locality: Mozambique , Magude. Holotype female in coll. ZSM.

Remark.
M. cana
was originally described as a distinct species. The detailed comparison of specimens collected in South Mozambique and Egypt revealed no significant differences in the configuration of genitalia, however the Southern African specimens are uniformly paler, having graphite greyish forewing ground colour, while the North African ones are much darker, with dark brownish forewing ground colour. The species might have had in the past a continuous distribution in Eastern Africa along the coast of Red Sea and Indian Ocean, later it had probably been splitted into morphologically slightly different populations (
M. aegyptiaca sahelica
Hacker, 2012
in the Sahel and Tanzania , and
M. aegyptiaca bischoffi
Hacker, 2012
in Yemen ). Separating the southernmost population on species rank is not justified based on these minor morphological differences, so
cana
has herewith been placed within the species
aegyptiaca
as valid subspecies.
